column4: I just changed ( via chown) a DIR so I can extract tarballs ( /usr/local/games/) but its still refusing me..and I think thats wude!
you may need to extract the tarball using 'sudo tar' rather than 'tar' since a normal user can't write to /usr/local/games
im using fileroller which is hooked into mozillla
Make a directory called 'Games' in your homespace ?
well ..I like to  use /usr/local in case I add users
You could extract it into your homespace to begin with; then use 'sudo mv' to move the install into /usr/local/games ?
rad..what a surprise to see firefox 1.0 preview !! in unbuntu..sweet
yes I could..i'm going to try sudo tar first
I guess fileroller isn't linked in mozilla..must be mime types
I just did a chmod on it and voila LOL
